newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Mahindra group to enter time-share segment.
newsitem.headline: India's Mahindra group to enter time-share segment.

text.p: India's Mahindra group said on Friday it planned to enter the time-share business through a new company, Mahindra Holidays & Resorts India Pvt Ltd.
"The cost of real estate in India is disproportionate to income levels," Arun Nanda, executive director of flagship company Mahindra & Mahindra, told a news conference.
He said the time-share resorts would offer members a choice of affordable holidays.

Nanda said the company had been set up with an initial capital of 150 million rupees which would go up to 450 million by the third year of operation. The project cost over the next three years is likely to be around 600 million rupees.
The Mahindra group will own a "significant" portion of the new firm, Nanda said. He said the company plans a private equity placement to institutional investors in around six months.
It plans to sell around 4,000-5,000 units in the first year, said R. Ramanathan, president and CEO of Mahindra Holidays.
Ramanathan said the first holiday would be offered in 12 months. Customers would be offered a selection of products ranging from 48,000 rupees to 198,000 for a week-long annual holiday for 33 years.
The Mahindra group already has interests in real estate, hotels and infrastructure.
